Please<br>note the abstract deadline!<br>Best regards,<br>Omar Anchassi<br><br>\ufffd\ufffd\ufffdIslamic Law and Empire\ufffd\ufffd\ufffd<br>IGLP: The Conference, Harvard Law School<br>*1-3 June 2015*, Cambridge, MA, USA<br><br>Panel and Paper submissions deadline: *13 March 2015*<br><br>We are pleased to announce that on 1-3 June 2015 the Institute for Global<br>Law and Policy (IGLP) will host an international Conference at Harvard Law<br>School to showcase innovative thinking about global law and policy. In<br>addition to this larger Conference, there will be four mini-conferences<br>focused on specific themes. Entitled "Operating Islamic Jurisprudence in Non-Muslim Jurisdictions: Traditional Islamic Precepts and Contemporary Controversies in the United States", it is part of a special issue on Shari'a and Halakha in North America<http://scholarship.kentlaw.iit.edu/cklawreview/>. The analysis focuses on the Qur'anic attitude to freedom of faith and human dignity as well as on the scope and root cause of [...] Mobeen 2015-02-19T17:11:29-00:00 2015-02-19T17:11:29-00:00 Muslim Leadership in Britain Conference - Registration and Programme Details https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRAIS;49509d92.1502 *** Apologies for Cross-Posting ***<br><br>Muslim Leadership in Britain: Developments, Challenges & Opportunities \ufffd\ufffd Wed<br>1st April 2015<br>Organised by Muslims in Britain Research Network (MBRN) in association with<br>the University of Central Lancashire (UCLan).<br><br>Muslim leadership has changed dramatically in Britain over the last two<br>decades. These changes are characterised by a move away from early forms of<br>leadership within discrete religious communities, through to dynamic<br>professional engagement by Muslims in the spheres of politics, local<br>government, education, culture, business and the charities sector. While<br>faith and community leadership undoubtedly remain important, it is<br>increasingly clear that new avenues [...] CASAW Admin Office 2015-02-17T10:53:11+00:00 2015-02-17T10:53:11+00:00 REMINDER: CASAW Internship Opportunity - Banipal Magazine, London https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRAIS;6d926ae5.1502 The University of Edinburgh is a charitable body, registered in<br>Scotland, with registration number SC005336. The scholarship is part of a wider project on Ethical Monotheism and is intended for a student who will explore the ethical formation of young people within monotheistic communities in a pluralistic urban setting.For more information and to apply: http://www.bbk.ac.uk/psychosocial/news/phd-studentship-in-ethical-monotheism-1Please do circulate to any students who might be interested.Best [...] Charles Woodhead 2015-02-16T14:00:13+00:00 2015-02-16T14:00:13+00:00 Gender in Judaism and Islam: Common Lives, Uncommon Heritage https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRAIS;e0312504.1502 Dear BRAIS subscribers,<br><br>We hope you find these titles of interest.<br><br>[9781479801275]<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/gender-in-judaism-and-islam>Gender in Judaism and Islam<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/gender-in-judaism-and-islam><br><br>Common Lives, Uncommon Heritage<http://www.combinedacademic.co.uk/gender-in-judaism-and-islam><br>Edited by Firoozeh Kashani-Sabet & Beth S. Wenger<br>"Firoozeh Kashani-Sabet and Beth S. Wenger are to be congratulated for assembling a compelling collection that illuminates a wide range of issues around gender in Judaism and Islam drawn from discussions of Muslim and Jewish law to analyses of contemporary feminism to crimes of passion and 'honor killings' in the modern Arab world. She charts the major unintended consequence of this missionary project, namely the emergence of the Muslim Brotherhood movement and the rise of the Muslim welfare state in Egypt. Work that we support includes<br>but is not limited to: [...] sadiya@khizrafoundation.org 2015-01-07T11:47:57+00:00 2015-01-07T11:47:57+00:00 Extra Seats now available - Everyday Muslim Symposium https://www.jiscmail.ac.uk:443/cgi-bin/webadmin?A2=BRAIS;d2c83211.1501 *** Apologies for cross-posting***<br><br>Dear Colleagues<br><br>You are invited to attend the inaugural symposium of the Everyday Muslim<br>project. This one-day symposium, organised by the Khizra Foundation in<br>partnership with Bishopsgate Institute, is dedicated to exploring constructions<br>of Muslim heritage in the UK. It aims to bring together those working in<br>academic, arts and media organisations to interrogate the changing ways in which<br>everyday Muslim life has been represented and archived.
